item.title: Report E-2024060381
item.description:
Report E-2024060381

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding punctured plastic jugs of Bifenture (Pesticide). Four plastic jugs of product were punctured by a forklift. This resulted in an estimated release of 4-gallons of product impacting the wooden trailer floor in a 3’x3’ area and the concrete/asphalt beneath the trailer in a 20’x3’ area. A Contractor contained and clean-up the release using oil dry. The four damaged jugs were overpacked into one 55-gallon DF for waste disposal along with the impacted oil dry. No storm drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024060387
item.description:
Report E-2024060387

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDP experienced a UN1760 Step Down Low Odor Finish Liquidator release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to a load shift, causing the pallet to tip over. The impacted area was cleaned and neutralized with citric acid solution, baking soda, and absorbents. The damaged pail and all impacted cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining pails in the shipment were re-stacked and secured for continued transit. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A truck was being offloaded at Veolia's ten day intransit facility when an employee discovered liquid on the floor of the trailer. One drum was identified as having a loose bung which allowed the liquid to escape from the drum during transportation. Trained Veolia employees remediated the spill and overpacked the drum for continued transportation to the disposal site.

item.title: Report E-2024060383
item.description:
Report E-2024060383

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 14, 2024, thirty (30) one-gallon pails of paint fell in transit and released approximately eighteen (18) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint-impacted trailer. All impacted material was collected and containerized into six (6) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060370
item.description:
Report E-2024060370

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: BUTTE
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBU experienced a UN3352 Omni Brand Lambda 1 EC release from 36 boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to the cardboard packaging only due to lose caps on all jugs. The jugs were poured into (3) 55-gallon poly drums to be disposed of as pure liquids. The jugs were then rinsed, and all rinse water was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted cardboard, empty poly jugs, and impacted pads were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024060366
item.description:
Report E-2024060366

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: LIVERMORE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 14, 2024, at 0257 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Livermore, California regarding the release of Unitex Melt Down Plus. Roadrunner terminal personnel discovered the release of 5 gallons of Unitex Melt Down Plus (UN1760 Corrosive Liquid, N.O.S(Ethanolamine) 8, II) from (1) 5-gallon plastic pail. The release was caused by a puncture and contained to an area inside the trailer. Terminal personnel were able to clean the release with absorbents and containerized the waste in (1) 55-gallon DF and staged it onsite for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060426
item.description:
Report E-2024060426

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSL experienced a UN2922 Santoflex 44PF release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 55-gallons of product released to a 20’ x 8' area of the trailer floor & a 30' x 10' area of the asphalt lot below due to a forklift puncture. The impacted areas were cleaned with a neutral soap solution and absorbents. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. The impacted absorbents, cut up impacted pallets, and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into (13) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

RESPONDER OPENED UP THE PACKAGE AND FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS AND THE INSIDE CARDBOARD TO BE WET. FURTHER INSPECTION SHOWED 1 OF THE CONTAINERS HAD A VERY LOOSE CAP THAT HAD ALLOWED THE CONTENTS OF THE CONTAINER TO LEAK OUT.

  • Description: Car was found to be leaking during movement and was set out to the Rip track. Upon inspection it was determined that the rupture disc was blown, and the cover/cap was missing. The cable connecting the cover/cap to the trivent assembly was frayed. The disc gave evidence of a surge that ruptured the disc in an outward direction. I was unable to determine if a surge protector was present. The disc was replaced, and the shipper was advised to get an MRU to replace the cover/cap and have the car requalified.

item.title: Report E-2024060428
item.description:
Report E-2024060428

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: ELK GROVE VILLAGE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6in-by-200ft area of the concrete roadway and a 53’-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that thirty (30) gallons of material was released due to load shift that resulted in a puncture to one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The trailer was offloaded to locate the damaged container. Hepaco personnel deployed a neutralizer and then used granular absorbents and pads to gather the released material. The impacted pallets were broken down and placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. Various cleanup debris and spent absorbents were gathered and placed into four (4) additional 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged drum was over packed into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum still containing approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product. The generated waste was left at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060417
item.description:
Report E-2024060417

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 7, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon can of UN2922 was damaged in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized poly sheeting, drums and liners, cleaners and absorbent pads, plug and patch kit, additional pallets, and hand tools to remediate the sulfuric acid-impacted impacted dock floor. TLE personnel solidified and neutralized the damaged pail of product. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon vented poly drums to be staged onsite.

  • City: NEENAH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 7, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was punctured in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Valley Environmental Response (VER) to remediate the impacted site. VER deployed neutralizers to the trailer floor, surrounding cargo and collected one (1) 5-gallon plastic pail into one (1) 55-gallon double lined poly drum. VER utilized absorbent pads and neutralizer to the impacted cargo. VER neutralized the wooden pallet, deconstructed it with hand tools, and placed it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Crews utilized hand tools to collect all spent absorbent pads, neutralizers, and containerized it into the same one (1) 55-gallon poly drum as the deconstructed pallet. VER staged onsite the two (2) 55-gallon poly drums of waste for further handling

  • City: MONTEBELLO

  • Description: On June 7, 2024, four (4) one-gallon jugs of UN3149 were punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and adjacent cardboard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE personnel collected the damaged jugs, and impacted cardboard box, for disposal. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the UN3149-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All UN3149 impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) vented 55-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060425
item.description:
Report E-2024060425

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-01
  • City: NEW HARTFORD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5100
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE SHIPPING FROM NEW HARTFORD, NY TO SYRACUSE, NY BROKE OPEN REQUIRING A PACKAGE REWRAP. UPON INSPECTION A MC LEOD GAGE DEVICE CONTAINING MERCURY HAD BROKEN. AN OUTSIDE RESPONSE TEAM WAS CONTACTED. THE OUTSIDE RESPONDER CONTAINED, CLEANED, AND REMOVED THE PACKAGE AND CONTENTS FROM THE FACILITY. NO EVACUATION OF THE FACILITY WAS NEEDED AND NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED. THE OUTSIDE RESPONDER ADVISED AN ESTIMATED FIVE POUNDS OF MERCURY WAS CONTAINED IN THE MC LEOD GAGE DEVICE WITH APPROXIMATELY 30 ML (1 OZ) OF MERCURY RELEASING. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS OFFERED FOR AIR SERVICE BUT ONLY MOVED IN THE GROUND NETWORK PRIOR TO THE LEAKAGE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: On 05/20/2024, at 1716 hours, personnel in the CSXT Toledo Docks Lakefront Yard, discovered GATX6902, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and Chemtrade, NRC, Ohio EPA were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2024-05-20-00193). EnviroServe, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the liquid line closure cap was less then tool tight and could be turned by hand several times. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative (Mark Logan, 236-885-2466). Contractor personnel secured the cap and decontaminated the car.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver finished C02 customer fill process. While fill hose was being retracted on hose reel, it unexpectedly contacted the vapor ball valve and it inadvertently opened causing Carbon Dioxide to vent out of the delivery vehicle. Driver could not visually locate vapor ball valve due to carbon dioxide cloud. Driver's supervisor instructed driver to move vehicle to open area so cloud could dissipate. Local fire department was contacted by witness. Fire department showed up on scene and assisted with closing vapor ball valve which stopped the uncontrolled release of carbon dioxide. The total event took approximately 40 minutes.

item.title: Report I-2024060016
item.description:
Report I-2024060016

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-06
  • City: Kansas City
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 5/6/2024 CPKC Hazmat received notice that a loaded liquid Argon car, MTGX 7050, was observed Ieaking during an inbound train inspection at the Kansas City, MO Knoche yard, and had an iced cabinet. CPKC Hazmat mobilized to the yard along with a railroad qualified response contractor to assist with mitigating the release. Upon arrival, responders found MTGX 7050 to be 85-90% empty. Also, the car needed to be switched into a track where it could be safely secured. Temporary measures were taken to stop the leak utilizing a freeze patch. Hazmat requested the car be isolated in a suitable track for further action. During switching to isolation, the freeze patch failed and after being isolated, the car finished depressurizing. Responders determined the source of the leak was a broken Liquid Sample Valve Feedline(V-13R) in right cabinet, and a loose fitting in the left cabinet on the PB Vapor Recovery Isolation/Check pipe fitting(RCV-1). The total estimated release is 15,336 gallons of liquid Argon(total load loss). The car was on hazmat hold until an OTMA-1 was obtained to move the car to home shop. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.

item.title: Report I-2024060018
item.description:
Report I-2024060018

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: ALBANY
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TEAM TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Tank truck was being loaded with 45,000 lbs of formaldehyde solution, Toward end of loading, a high level probe should have stopped the pump and prevented overfilling of the tank. When overfilling occurred, the driver recognized it almost immediately and shut down the pump manually. Spilled formaldehyde solution flowed down the side of the truck on to the truck loading pad, and then toward secondary containment ditch to the east of. the pad. The truck and loading pad were washed down with water into the containment ditch where it drained into a sump and was conveyed by in-place submersible pump to a recycle storage tank. Spilage was estimated at 20-to-30 gallons. Investigation found that high level probe was set to trigger 10-seconds after contact w/ solution. It should have been set for a 1-second response

item.title: Report E-2024060364
item.description:
Report E-2024060364

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: CAMERON
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 13, 2024 at 1039 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Cameron, Missouri regarding the release of MULTI-PURPOSE MB COLD ADHESIVE. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of a total of 1 ounce of MULTI-PURPOSE MB COLD ADHESIVE from (3) 4.75-gallon pails due to being crushed. The release was caused by the load strap crushing the pails and was contained to the side of the pails only. Contractors were able to collect the damaged pails and place them into a plastic drum without complication. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY A SORTER IN THE HUB SECONDARY. THE SORTER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED THE SUPERVISOR. A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 3 MINUTES DONNING THE CORRECT PPE. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT ONE OF THE LIDS ON ONE OF THE INNER ONE GALLON PLASTIC CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 OF A TURN AND 6 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING SCREENING PROCESS OF A PREBUILT UNIT (PBE) ULD AAA96907 OFFERED TO UPS AIR CARGO SERVICES IN MIAMI, FLORIDA GOING TO DOMINICAN REPUBLIC, WE DISCOVERED ONE FIBERBOARD BOX CONTAINING A LITHIUM ION BATTERY. THE PACKAGE FOUND INSIDE THE SHIPPER BUILT CONTAINER HAS A PARTIALLY REMOVED LABEL THAT RESEMBLES A BATTERY MARK. INNER PACKAGE CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALED ONE LI-ION LAWN MOWER PACKED WITH THE LITHIUM ION 21V BATTERY. DANGEROUS GOODS ARE PROHIBITED IN ALL SHIPPER PREBUILT AIR CONTAINERS.

  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Fred Harris City Driver at 104 called safety to report a tote that he unloaded off trailer 556374 was leaking on the trailer floor and on the dock floor in front of bay 14. Fred stated he noticed it leaking then he removed the tote from the trailer and set it on the dock floor. Safety asked if he kn ew how the tote was damaged, Fred stated he did not know and that it could have been the forklift forks while unloading the tote but was not sure. Fred stated the tote was dripping from underneath the tote and was leaking on the dock. Fred stated the tote was not full and does not look like it leake d very much in the trailer but looks like some has dried up on the trailer floor.

item.title: Report X-2024060432
item.description:
Report X-2024060432

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: JAMAICA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/5/2024 at approximately 1900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4009660 at the ramp facility in Jamacia NY, reporting an undeclared battery shipment. The shipment consisted of 4 cardboard containers wrapped in black shrinkwrap, each filled with used and damaged cell phones. None of the packages were properly declared as UN3481 Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment Section I. The shipment was not prepared in accourdance with IATA Regulation. The entire shipment was held pending an investigation by the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2024061145
item.description:
Report X-2024061145

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A SINGLE FIVE GALLON JERRICAN WITH ORGANIC PEROXIDE (5.2) AND CORROSIVE (8) DIAMOND LABELS. THE UN SPECIFICATION 3H1 JERRICAN LEAKED 4.5 GALLONS FROM THE CLOSURE WHICH WAS NOT SEALED. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX. THERE ARE NO ORIENTATION ARROWS ON THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX. UN SPECIFICATION MARKS ON THE INNER JERRICAN ARE 3H1/Y14/100/221/USA/+AA4752 WITH VENTED CAP. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER EK2706, FL LABS, 301 S MISSOURI AVE, CLEARWATER FL 33756-5833.

  • City: HIGHLAND HEIGHTS

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: AIR PACKAGE FROM USA TO TRINIDAD AND TOBAGO WAS INSPECTED DUE TO THERMAL TRACKING LABEL AND INVOICE STATING SUPER GLUE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED SEVEN X 16 OUNCE BOTTLES OF FLAMMABLE CA-PLUS QT IV ACTIVATOR. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM OHIO USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER Y21W67, ALLAN VALEO, 7250 ASHBURTON DR, KNOXVILLE TN 37909-3713.

item.title: Report I-2024050082
item.description:
Report I-2024050082

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: KIRKWOOD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: The New York Susquehanna and Western Railway
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 22000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: A FREIGHT TRAIN OPERATED BY THE NYSW RAILWAY, WAS TRAVELING EAST THROUGITHE TOWN OF KIRKWOOD, NY. A FARM TRACTOR ENTERED THE ROW AS IT DID NOT STOP AT A CROSSING. THE TRACTOR WAS STRUCK BY THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE. WHEN THE TRACTOR WAS STRUCK, A PIECE FROM THE TRACTOR BROKE OFF, AND FLEW INTO THE SIDE OF THE FUEL TANK CAUSING A GASH. DISEL FUEL LEAKED FROM THE GASH. NYSW AND LOCAL EMS PERSONAL RESPONDED, AND PLACED MATERIALS IN THE GASH TO STOP THE FUEL FROM LEAKING. APPROX. DURATION OF THE LEAK, 10 MINUTES.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 10, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1230 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 25-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Green Site Services Group (GSSG) to remediate the impacted site. GSSG personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024060165
item.description:
Report E-2024060165

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: EAST SAINT LOUIS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 6, 2024, seven (7) boxes of UN3149 were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. EW personnel collected two (2) damaged 1-gallon containers of UN3149 and seven (7) damaged boxes of UN3149 (four 1-gallon containers in one box) and containerized them into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum as hazardous waste. EW personnel deployed vermiculite to the impacted surfaces of the trailer and worked them in with hand tools. EW personnel then utilized absorbent wipes to remove any residual amount of UN3149 from the impacted surfaces. All UN3149 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum

  • Description: THE HAZMAT CLERK ALERTED RESPONDER OF A HAZMAT SPILL. RESPONDER GRABBED THE SPILL TUG TO HEAD OVER TO THE SPILL BY THE M6 CLERK. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER PUT ON PPE AND GRABBED DECISION TREE. RESPONDER SAW IT WAS A CORROSIVE LABEL, FOLLOWED DECESION TREE TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER PROCEEDED TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL AND TOOK IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered during sort operations. 1 fiberboard box containing 4- 3.785 Liter plastic bottles of Up-Cyde Pro 2.0EC (insecticide). One of the bottles leaked, but it is unknown if it was punctured or a loose top due to the strong odor it was emitting. The spill clean up employee was suited in PPE with his respirator. The package and all of its contents were immediately placed in a salvage drum. Several employees (4) complained of burning throat, light headedness. One out of the 4 also complained of respiratory issues and went to the minor med/clinic the following day but was NOT hospitalized. The package is being held for FAA Investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024060032
item.description:
Report E-2024060032

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-02
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 02, 2024 at 1430 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately 7 gallons of WHT03P1 Monomer-Free Polyester Pigment Dispersion. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of a total of 7 gallons of WHT03P1 Monomer-Free Polyester Pigment Dispersion (UN1866, 3 III) from (3) 5-gallon plastic pails. The release was caused by the pallet not having any dunnage, and the pails falling during transit. The release was contained to an area on the trailer floor and a 4ft x 4ft area of concrete beneath the trailer. Contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged pails containing material for reprocessing, were placed in (1) 55-gallon DF and the waste was placed in (1) 55-gallon DF and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060136
item.description:
Report E-2024060136

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-01
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee noticed spillage outside of a Veolia straight truck parked in the 10-Day Facility lot around 9:00a., and reported the incident immediately. Employees immediately offloaded the truck to identify the drum that was releasing the material, to find that the suspect drum had imploded. There were no evident punctures or abrasions on the drum, so the suspected cause of the leakage is due to a faulty seam on the drum. The spill was cleaned up with oil dry and the drum was overpacked for continued transportation to the disposal facility.

item.title: Report I-2024050041
item.description:
Report I-2024050041

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STG Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The release occurred due to the intermodal container tipping on its side while in the STG Logistics yard, due to heavy weight at top of container. As a result, a minimal amount of product released from the seal on the tipped totes. Free product was contained to gravel surface just below the intermodal container. Container was up righted, and Ambipar was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, Ambipar inspected the container and confirmed totes were in tact, a minimal amount of free product had released from the seal, and was contained to container surface and gravel. Ambipar proceeded to use absorbent material to absorb the free product, and surface scraped the impacted gravel from within the lot. Freight was offloaded, container was cleaned, and shipment was reloaded and secured. Two 55-gallon drums of spent absorbent, cleanup debris, and impacted gravel were generated.

  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a Fedex envelope was found smoking on a slide. A spill agent was called the smoke stopped before the agent arrived. While investigating the shipment the agent discovered two sealed lead acid batteries non-spillable inside. The batteries were packed in fiberboard boxes in the envelope. One of the batteries had burn marks inside of the fiberboard box. The package didn't have any DG markings, paperwork attached also there was no shipping label on the outer packaging. The shipment is being held at the MEMH location.

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: EAST MOLINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Response Management Services LLC was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-30ft area of the trailer floor and concrete lot and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released due to falling freight that crushed one (1) 15-gallon poly drum due to a load shift. Response Management Services personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizer to the impacted areas and gathered the spent absorbents. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The recovered absorbents were containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal

  • Description: On June 5, 2024, at 1455 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by CEVA Logistics personnel in Dallas, Texas regarding the release of IPA TT-I-735A. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of a total of 1 gallon of IPA TT-I-735A (UN1219, 3, II) from (3) 5-gallon steel pails. The release was caused by a load shift and contained to a 3ft x 3ft area on the trailer floor. Contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged pails containing residual material were placed in (1) 95-gallon overpack DF and the impacted absorbents were placed in (1) 55-gallon DF and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted concrete dock. FCE utilized hand tools to collect the released material and neutralizer into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew placed the plastic shrink wrap, Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and debris into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 29, 2024, one (1) 55-pound bag of UN2680 was torn during loading and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Republic Services (RS) to remediate the impacted site. RS personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the lithium hydroxide-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060100
item.description:
Report E-2024060100

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: PUNXSUTAWNEY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BUFFALO & PITTSBURGH RAILROAD, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Crew was switching the north bound road train out at Riker yard. The conductor spotted railcar UTLX 211952 was leaking product out of the top of the car. The conductor stopped the move and called BPRR Management. After investigating the manway seal on the top of the rail car it was found to be defective and allowed product to come out. No product was on the ground - only on the side of the car. Crew wiped down side of rail car with absorbent pads and disposed of properly. Notification was made to Rita Mager, Environmental Director. MEI came to Riker yard and made repairs on the car. MEI Report, B&P Spill Report, Photos attached; also available upon request to rita.mager@gwrr.com

  • Description: When loading a pallet of pails into a trailer the forklift operator stuck the forkblades into the pallet the pails were staged on and while doing so the forkblades were slightly tilted back causing one of the blades to go through the wooden slats of the pallet consequently slightly puncturing a pail contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.

item.title: Report E-2024060128
item.description:
Report E-2024060128

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: WHITE CITY
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROGUE VALLEY TERMINAL RAILROAD CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Oregon DOT Rail Safety Inspector Christopher Kunzei (FRA Inspector ID H4102) discovered tank car GATX 21575 was venting odor (vapor) during an on-board inspection of the top of the railcar on 05/15/2024. Inspector Kunzei promptly notified railroad (RVT) train crew, followed by written report (FRA Report H4102-2024-0153). Railroad train crew stated that they did not smell the odor from the ground during their ground-level inspection at time of shipment acceptance at the Shipper facility. Amount or duration of odor venting is unknown. Car had been in transit less than 2 hours (less than 1 mile from Shipper facility). Railcar was empty (residue) at time of incident, previously contained Methyl Ethyl Ketone (UN 1193, STCC 4909243). Upon subsequent Shipper re-inspection following the incident, the Shipper determined that the cause of odor venting was due to a damaged (worn) manway gasket.
